title: Job Vacancies at Owens and Xley Consults
content:
Owens and Xley Consults is a recruitment firm based in Lagos that offers business advisory and consulting services to help Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs).

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Accountant

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and submit daily financial reports to management, including:
	Total sales breakdown (cash, card, and transfer payments).
	Daily expenses, deductions, and cash movements.
	Pending customer payments and outstanding balances.
	Pre-order payment updates and balances.
	Payment Confirmation and Verification:
	Confirm and track all payments made through:
	Bank transfers for customer purchases.
	Pre-orders and online transactions.
	Delivery and personal shopper payments.
	Daily sales across in-store and online channels.
	Operational expenses (fueling, logistics, supplies, and maintenance).
	Inventory Management and System Updates:
	Update and maintain accurate inventory data, including:
	New stock arrivals and product categories.
	Sold, damaged, or promotional items.
	Pre-order confirmations and stock adjustments.
	Maintain accurate and organized financial documentation, including:
	Daily transactions and cash flow logs.
	Delivery fee payments and logistics balances.
	Purchases made by management for store operations.
	Petty cash disbursements and reconciliations.
	Monthly financial summaries and management reports.
	Match expenses with receipts and supporting documentation.
	Maintain VAT and tax records in compliance with statutory requirements.
	Prepare and process monthly payroll.
	Adjust for deductions, overtime, and other allowances.


Education and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2 - 4 years of experience in accounting or financial management, preferably in the retail or fashion industry.
	Professional certifications (ACA, ACCA) are an added advantage.
	Behavioural Competencies
	Highly meticulous and accurate in financial documentation.
	Proactive in resolving financial discrepancies.
	Strong time management skills for daily and monthly deliverables.
	Collaborative and dependable team player.


Skills
Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in accounting software (QuickBooks, Excel, or similar).
	Strong understanding of financial reporting and reconciliation.
	Knowledge of inventory and retail financial systems.
	Familiarity with Nigerian tax laws and compliance requirements.


Soft Skills:


	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Analytical and problem-solving mindset.
	Clear communication and teamwork abilities.
	Integrity and confidentiality in handling financial data.


Application Closing Date: 6th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: recruitment@owensxley.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Sales Assistant

Job Locations: Ikoyi & Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Duration: 2 Months (November – December)

About the Role


	They are seeking enthusiastic and customer-oriented Sales Assistants to support store operations during the busy festive season. This is a great short-term opportunity for individuals who enjoy retail, gift packaging, and creating delightful shopping experiences.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet and assist customers with product selection in-store.
	Wrap gifts and prepare party packs promptly and neatly.
	Stock and restock shelves to ensure attractive product displays.
	Conduct walkthroughs to maintain store cleanliness and product availability.
	Support in store opening and closing procedures.
	Assist sales associates and supervisors with daily operations.
	Participate in promotional activities and in-store events.
	Perform other related tasks as assigned.


Required Skills & Qualifications


	Minimum of a High School Diploma; undergraduates are encouraged to apply.
	0 - 1 year of experience in retail, sales, or customer service.
	Basic knowledge of sales, customer service, and store operations.
	Ability to wrap gifts and prepare party packs efficiently.
	Friendly, customer-focused, and team-oriented attitude.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
	Enthusiastic, proactive, and dedicated to customer satisfaction.
	Experience in gift wrapping or stocking is a plus.
	Proximity to the store locations is very important.


Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@owensxley.com using "Sales Assistant" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Personal Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are looking for a highly organized, resourceful, and proactive Personal Assistant to provide dedicated support to the CEO.
	The ideal candidate will possess excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail, and the ability to anticipate needs and take initiative in managing both professional and personal tasks.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop a deep understanding of the CEO’s preferences, priorities, and work style to effectively anticipate needs.
	Manage daily schedules, appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
	Handle wardrobe coordination, personal shopping, and other personal errands as required.
	Maintain confidentiality and professionalism at all times.
	Assist with general administrative duties and ensure smooth day-to-day operations.


Requirements & Skills


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Prior experience supporting an executive or in a similar role is an advantage.
	Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and general computer applications.
	Excellent communication, time management, and organizational skills.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask effectively.
	Discreet, reliable, and presentable, with a professional demeanor.


Salary
N200,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 31st October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@owensxley.com using “Personal Assistant” as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) Store Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Our client is seeking an energetic and experienced candidate to oversee daily store operations, lead floor staff, and ensure an exceptional customer experience.
	The ideal candidate is organized, customer-focused, and skilled in managing both people and inventory in a dynamic retail or hospitality environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate and assign roles to floor staff to ensure seamless, efficient, and professional customer service.
	Schedule and manage staff shifts, adjusting as necessary to accommodate peak hours, events, or workload changes.
	Interact with customers at the service area and payment point to ensure they are comfortable, satisfied, and promptly attended to.
	Implement strategies to gather and analyze customer feedback, using insights to drive continuous service improvement.
	Forecast sales trends to guide product ordering, considering peak periods, seasonal variations, promotions, and customer preferences.
	Monitor, track, and maintain optimal inventory levels to prevent shortages or overstocking.
	Regularly inspect the store’s cleanliness, organization, and visual presentation, ensuring it aligns with brand standards.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of inventory, sales transactions, and customer interactions for operational analysis and reporting.
	Collaborate with the operations and procurement teams to ensure timely replenishment and efficient store performance.
	Drive a culture of accountability, teamwork, and excellence among store staff.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or a related field.
	3 – 5 years of experience in a supervisory or store management role, preferably within the hospitality or retail industry.
	Strong leadership, interpersonal, and customer service skills.
	Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic inventory management tools.
	Demonstrated ability to manage staff, resolve conflicts, and maintain a positive customer experience.


Salary
N250,000 - N270,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 3rd November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidats should send their CV and Cover Letter to: recruitment@owensxley.com using "Store Manager - Lagos" as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Avetium Consult
content:
Avetium Consult is a Business Process Outsourcing and Technology solution company incorporated in Nigeria. Avetium Consult is what happens when top experts of top multinationals from diverse fields and similar values come together to deliver transformational solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Customer Service Representative (French Speaking)

Job Location: Allen, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This is a full-time on-site Customer Service Representative (French/English) role located in Lagos.
	The Customer Service Representative will be responsible for handling customer inquiries, resolving issues, and providing exceptional service in both French and English languages.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree
	Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Customer Service Representative in a reputable firm.
	Customer Satisfaction and Customer Experience skills
	Fluency in French and English languages
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to multitask and solve problems efficiently
	Previous customer service experience is preferred
	Knowledge of CRM systems is a plus.


Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVS to: semira.ikioda@avetiumconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Direct Sales Agent

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT), Delta & Plateau
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve enterprise sales targets and revenue goals
	Identify and prioritize new business opportunities by analyzing market trends, customer needs, and competitor activity.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including C-level executives, decision makers, and influencers.
	Collaborate with internal teams, including marketing, product development, and customer success, to ensure customer satisfaction and retention.
	Negotiate complex contracts and proposals, ensuring terms and conditions align with company policies and legal requirements.
	Manage and report on sales pipeline, forecasting revenue and providing regular updates to senior management.
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices, and share knowledge with colleagues and customers.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND in Marketing, Business Administration or any related course
	Minimum of 3 years of sales experience, preferably in sales of enterprise solutions.
	Proven record of exceeding sales targets
	Ability to create and develop sales strategies
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively.


Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: semira.ikioda@avetiumconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Quality Assurance Tester

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Designing test plans, scenarios, scripts and procedures.
	Executing tests on source code.
	Analyzing test results and reporting to the development team.
	Working with the development team to correct bugs and errors.
	Manage and monitor a team of testers.


QA Tester Requirements


	A bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field.
	2 years of experience in QA testing.
	Good working knowledge of test management software, programming languages and QA methodologies.
	Good team working and critical thinking skills.


Salary
N5,000 Daily (To be paid weekly). 

Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.




Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVS to: semira.ikioda@avetiumconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Territorial Development Representative (Sales)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	As a key member of our sales team, you will be responsible for identifying and capitalizing on new business opportunities, developing and maintaining relationships with existing customers, and driving revenue growth within your assigned territory.


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute a territory sales plan to achieve revenue targets
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities through research, networking, and cold calling
	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing customers to ensure customer satisfaction and loyalty
	Conduct market research to stay up-to-date on industry trends and competitor activity
	Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop and implement sales strategies
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing and related fields
	2 - 3 years of sales experience, preferably in Fintech sales
	Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Application Closing Date: 25th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: semira.ikioda@avetiumconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Maventeq Systems Limited
content:
Maventeq Systems Limited - Our client, an Oil and Gas company in Nigeria, is currently recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Contracts Engineer

Job Locations: Lagos & Rivers
Employment Type: Ful-time

Job Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Contracts Engineer shall be responsible for the management of contracts and agreements, ensuring they are strategically sourced, competitively tendered, and robustly administered.
	This role safeguards Company's commercial and legal interests, mitigates contractual risk, and fosters strong, performance-driven relationships with vendors and clients to support successful project execution and operational excellence.


Key Responsibilities & Duties


	Shall be responsible for driving the entire contract lifecycle, from initial tender to final close-out, ensuring all agreements are strategically sound and administratively robust.
	Shall support the CCM Lead in piloting the end-to-end tender process, including the preparation of Invitations to Tender (ITT) and coordination of pre-bid meetings and clarifications.
	Shall participate in conducting thorough technical and commercial bid evaluations, prepare award recommendations for the management consideration
	Shall actively participate in managing performance, correspondence, variations, and fostering strong, performance-driven relationships with vendors.
	Shall administer the formal change management process for contracts, evaluating, and documenting all variations and change orders.
	Shall review contractor invoices and payment certificates, verify alignment with contractual terms and actual work progress with the project management team.
	Shall proactively identify, assess, and mitigate contractual risks while ensuring full compliance with company policies and relevant regulations.
	Shall support the management of contractual claims and works with the project team to resolve disputes, maintaining comprehensive records throughout the process.
	Shall support the contractual close-out of projects, and contribute to lessons learned to support the development of the Approved Vendor List (AVL).


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	% of contracts awarded within the approved budget and schedule.
	Reduction in contractual disputes and claims.
	Compliance with tender and contract management procedures.
	Timeliness and accuracy of contract documentation and reporting.
	Vendor performance feedback and contract close-out effectiveness.


Qualifications & Experience


	Education: Bachelor's degree in Law, Business Administration, or any relevant course. A Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CIPS, RICS) is highly desirable.
	Experience: Minimum of 2-5 years of progressive experience in contract engineering or administration, specifically within the Oil & Gas, Energy, or EPCI project environment.


Technical Skills:


	In-depth knowledge of contract law, different forms of contract (e.g., FIDIC, LOGIC, BIMCO), and contracting strategies.
	Proven experience in tender preparation, bid evaluation, and contract negotiation.
	Proficiency in using Vendor Management Systems and ERP systems.
	Strong understanding of project management principles and project lifecycle.


Competencies & Behavioural Attributes:


	Excellent negotiation and influencing skills, with the ability to secure favourableterms.
	Meticulous attention to detail and strong analytical skills for complex contract review and analysis.
	Proactive in identifying and mitigating commercial risks before they materialize.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills for clear and effective correspondence and reporting.
	Unquestioned ethics and integrity, ensuring all dealings are transparent and compliant.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified Candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com using the Job position as subject of the mail.

Note: Only candidates who meet the job requirements will be contacted.

 

 

2.) Cost Controller

Job Location: Lagos
Service Division: Projects, Operations and Asset Maintenance
Reports To: PPS Manager

Job Purpose


	This position shall be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining detailed cost management systems to ensure project execution aligns with the established budget and forecast.
	The Cost Controller shall provide critical, forward-looking analysis and data-driven insights to support proactive decision-making by company executive management.


Key Responsibilities & Duties


	Shall develop and maintain the project's Cost Breakdown Structure (CBS) and establish the official cost baseline for all company projects and operations.
	Shall create detailed cost estimates for all project phases and prepare accurate forecasts (Estimate at Completion - EAC) to predict final project costs.
	Shall conduct Earned Value Management (EVM) analysis to measure project health using key indices (CPI, SPI) and assess schedule and cost performance.
	Shall implement and manage robust ERP systems (SAP, Odoo, etc) to track all project commitments, expenditures, and accruals against the approved budget.
	Shall identify, analyze, and report on cost variances, determining root causes and recommending corrective actions to management.
	Shall quantify the financial impact of project changes and trends, ensuring all impacts are captured in the Management of Change (MoC) process and budget updates.
	Shall work with the project and operations team to quantify financial risks and opportunities, and monitor the use of contingency funds.
	Shall generate timely and clear cost reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate financial status and projections to company management.
	Shall utilize the company's ERP (SAP, Odoo, etc) and project controls software as the primary tools for all cost management and reporting activities.
	Shall provide proactive, data-driven insights to support decision-making, offering early warnings of potential cost overruns and identifying cost-saving opportunities.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of cost forecasts (Variance between Forecasted EAC and Final Actual Cost).
	Accuracy and timeliness of Earned Value Management reporting.
	Effectiveness in early warning of cost overruns and identification of cost-saving opportunities.
	Quality and clarity of cost analysis and reporting.
	Adherence to project controls procedures and the ICMS framework.


Qualifications & Experience


	Education:Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Civil, Mechanical, Chemical, or similar) is required. A post-graduate qualification in Project Management or Finance is an advantage.
	Experience:Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in a cost engineering or project controls role within the Oil & Gas, Energy, or heavy construction industry.
	Technical Skills:
	
		Expert knowledge of cost engineering principles, Earned Value Management (EVM), and risk-based forecasting.
		Proficiency in using ERP systems (SAP, Odoo, etc)and advanced project controls software.
		Advanced skills in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Power BI).
		Strong understanding of project scheduling principles and their integration with cost control.
	
	


Competencies & Behavioural Attributes:


	Strong numerical and analytical skills with the ability to interpret technical data and its financial implications.
	A forward-looking approach, constantly seeking to identify trends and potential issues before they impact the budget.
	Meticulous attention to detail and a rigorous approach to data integrity and process.
	Ability to translate complex cost data into clear, actionable insights for the project team and management.
	Effectively collaborates with project managers, engineers, planners, and procurement specialists to achieve integrated project outcomes.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only candidates who meet the job requirements will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Project Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description


	The ideal candidate shall oversee the overall coordination and supervision of a Pipeline Project, ensuring alignment with Client's objective.
	The Project Manager shall be directly responsible for the overall day-to-day management and successful execution of the project, including planning, executing, and closing the project within defined scope, budget, and schedule.


Responsibilities


	Oversee detailed planning of all project phases, such as engineering closeout, procurement, and construction methodology.
	Manage contract review and execution, and shall ensure the review and endorsement of comprehensive drawings, specifications, material requisitions, and technical documentation.
	Coordinate with the Executive Management to finalize project objectives, milestones, and key performance indicators (KPIs)
	Oversee the tender process for subcontractors, ensuring adherence to procurement procedures and local content requirements.
	Approve vendor selections, contract awards, and expediting plans for long-lead items
	Monitor the EPC Contractor’s adherence to the Construction Execution Plan, HSE protocols, and QA/QC standards.
	Ensure rigorous supervision of all EPC Contractor's physical construction activities, verifying strict adherence to approved design specifications, safety standards, environmental regulations, and project timelines.
	Monitor the EPC Contractor’s adherence to approved welding procedures (WPS/WPQT) and NDT protocols.
	Manage overall site operations, including preparation, access, logistics, and resource mobilization/demobilization.
	Ensure accurate measurement and verification of work progress for invoicing, and shall prepare and submit regular, detailed project performance reports to the Client.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s / Master’s in Engineering or equivalent experienceMinimum 15 years in oil/gas projects, with 10 years in lead management roles for pipelines
	Strong leadership in EPC project management (oil & gas pipelines preferred).
	Proficiency in contract administration, risk management, and stakeholder coordination.
	Familiarity with API/ASME standards, Nigerian Content Laws, and HSE regulations.
	PMP/PRINCE2 certification
	IOSH/NEBOSH (HSE) certification (optional).
	Strong verbal, written, and organizational skills


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only candidates who meet the job requirements will be contacted.
